name: Hillstead Outpost
description: A rugged village perched on wind-swept hills. Stone watchtowers overlook golden meadows. The people here are wary, their eyes fixed on the treeline — something is out there.

story_actions.story_text: Patrol the outer perimeter with guards.
Track the missing livestock down the western slope.
Discover strange runes carved into a tree near the meadow.
Follow a bent branch and faint pawprints into the hills. They're fresh — and headed toward the gorge.
Climb the watchtower and gaze toward the dark gorge beyond the trees. A low howl drifts on the wind.

You arrive at Hillstead Outpost and are nearly knocked aside by a running child. A guard shouts, a wolf-horn sounds in the distance, and someone slams a door shut just ahead.

Whispers swirl around your presence. 'They came from the bridge?' — 'But the bridge was broken.' — 'Maybe the wolves followed them.'

No one has time to greet you properly. The village is in disarray.
A bloodied hunter paces near the outpost gates. 'Too many tracks. Too close. We’re being tested — and it’s not hunger.'
A large hound lies wounded beneath a porch. A child pets its head while whispering, 'He tried to warn us.'
A trader curses over a soaked crate. 'The valley’s flooding again. Can’t send grain east. And there’s... shapes in the shallows now.'
An elder woman grabs your arm. 'You crossed the bridge? Mirella sent you? Then maybe we’re not abandoned after all…'
You hear shouting. A courier mounts a horse and gallops toward the high road. 'Tell them Hillstead still stands!' someone calls after them.
A lone priest rings the chapel bell. No one listens. No one comes. You catch him murmuring prayers for 'the pact' beneath his breath.
You pass a home where someone bakes flatbread over a dying fire. The smell is nostalgic. The mood is anything but.
Later that night, a traveling tinker tells you the waters have shifted again. A hidden stone path near the lake is visible now — but only barely.
